question:
Select the correct direct narration of the given sentence.
Madhav applauded her, saying that she had done well.

(SSC CHSL 2022 T-2 (26 June 2023))
option_1: Madhav said, “Bravo! You been done well”.
option_2: Madhav say, “Bravo! You have be done well”.
option_3: Madhav say, “Bravo! You have done well”.
option_4: Madhav said, “Bravo! You have done well”.
solution:
We are given an indirect speech sentence:
Madhav applauded her, saying that she had done well.
We need to convert it to direct speech.

Step 1: Identify the reporting verb

  • “applauded” is used here to express appreciation.

  • In direct speech, such verbs are often followed by an exclamatory sentence like "Bravo!", "Well done!", or similar phrases.

Step 2: Convert past perfect into present perfect

  • “She had done well” becomes “You have done well” in direct narration.
    (Subject 'she' → becomes 'you', as Madhav is addressing her directly.)

Step 3: Include exclamatory remark

  • “saying” is replaced by an appropriate interjection like “Bravo!”

Step 4: Use correct tense and helping verbs

Now, match this with the options:

  • (a) ❌ “You been done well” – grammatically incorrect

  • (b) ❌ “You have be done well” – grammatically incorrect (wrong verb form)

  • (c) ❌ “Madhav say” – incorrect tense (should be “said” not “say”)

  • (d) ✅ “Madhav said, ‘Bravo! You have done well.’” – Correct tense, verb form, punctuation, and structure

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in indirect speech.
The lawyer told the father of the accused, “There is a rumour that he has some connection in that crime.”

(SSC CHSL 2022 T-2 (26 June 2023))
option_1: The lawyer told the father of the accused that there had been a rumour that he had some connection in that crime.
option_2: The lawyer told the father of the accused that there was a rumour that he has had some connection in that crime.
option_3: The lawyer told the father of the accused that there was a rumour that he was having some connection in that crime.
option_4: The lawyer told the father of the accused that there was a rumour that he had some connection in that crime.
solution:
Direct speech to Indirect speech rule-:

Rule to change Direct speech into Indirect speech-:

If the reporting verb (sentence outside the inverted comma) is in the past tense and Reported speech (inside the inverted comma) is in the present tense, then the following transformation will occur:

Simple Present ----- Simple Past.

Present Continuous ------ Past Continuous.

Present Perfect ------- Past Perfect.

Present Perfect Continuous ----- Past Perfect Continuous.

Thus, the correct Indirect form of the given sentence is:

The lawyer told the father of the accused that there was a rumour that he had some connection in that crime.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in indirect speech.
He always says to me, “I am perturbed.”

(SSC CHSL 2024 T-2)
option_1: He always tells me that he is perturbed by change.
option_2: He always tells me that he is going to be perturbed.
option_3: He always tells me that he is perturbed.
option_4: He always tells me that he is mostly perturbed.
solution:
In indirect speech, we report the content of what someone says without quoting their exact words. The sentence "He always says to me, 'I am perturbed.'" becomes "He always tells me that he is perturbed."

  • The present tense "I am" is changed to "he is" to match the subject "he" in indirect speech.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in direct speech.
He will say that he is okay.

(SSC CHSL 2024 T-2)
option_1: He will say, “I am okay.”
option_2: He will say, “I am always okay.”
option_3: He will say, “I was okay.”
option_4: He would say, “I am okay.”
solution: In direct speech, we quote the exact words spoken by the person. The sentence "He will say that he is okay" becomes "He will say, 'I am okay.'" Here, the exact words he says are quoted, and the present tense "I am" remains unchanged.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in indirect speech.
The patient says, “I am fine.”

(SSC CHSL 2024 T-2)
option_1: The patient says that he is fine.
option_2: The patient says that he would be fine.
option_3: The patient says that he will be fine.
option_4: The patient says that he was fine.
solution:
In indirect speech, when the reporting verb is in the present tense (like "says"), the present tense of the verb in direct speech is retained.

The sentence "The patient says that he is fine." accurately conveys the information while maintaining the present tense.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in reported speech.
He said to the mechanic, “Will you have the car ready by tomorrow morning?”

(SSC CHSL 2023 T-2 (10 Jan))
option_1: He asked the mechanic if he would have the car ready by the next morning.
option_2: He told the mechanic if he will have the car ready for the next morning.
option_3: He asked the mechanic if he will have the car ready by the previous morning.
option_4: He said the mechanic whether he would has the car ready by the following morning.
solution:
The correct answer is: He asked the mechanic if he would have the car ready by the next morning.

Change of Modals:

Shall/Will -> Should/Would

May -> Might

Can -> Could

Therefore, He asked the mechanic if he would have the car ready by the next morning.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in reported speech.
Anil said to Ria, “I know where everything is kept in the kitchen.”

(SSC CHSL 2023 T-2 (10 Jan))
option_1: Anil told Ria that he knows where everything was kept in the kitchen.
option_2: Anil told Ria that he knew where everything is kept in the kitchen.
option_3: Anil asked Ria that he knows where everything was kept in the kitchen.
option_4: Anil told Ria that he knew where everything was kept in the kitchen.
solution:
The correct option that expresses the given sentence in reported speech is: Anil told Ria that he knew where everything was kept in the kitchen.

Rules:

Say/said remains unchanged in Indirect speech.

“Say” to changes into “tell” and “said to” changes into ‘told’.

Change in Tense:

Simple present -> Simple past -> Past perfect -> No change.

Therefore, “Anil told Ria that he knew where everything was kept in the kitchen.” is the correct answer.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in indirect speech.
Rakesh said, “Wow! What a beautiful house”.

(SSC CHSL 2023 T-2 (2 Nov))
option_1: Rakesh exclaimed that it was a beautiful house.
option_2: Rakesh exclaimed with sorrow that it was a beautiful house.
option_3: Rakesh told that it had been a beautiful house.
option_4: Rakesh exclaimed with surprise that it was must be beautiful house.
solution:
In exclamatory sentences:

Said + wow! -------> exclaimed with joy.

Active voice ------ Passive voice

Rakesh said, “Wow! What a beautiful house”. Rakesh exclaimed that it was a beautiful house.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in reported speech.
The captain said to the soldiers, “Follow the enemy.”

(SSC CHSL 2023 T-2 (2 Nov))
option_1: The captain charged his soldiers to followed the enemy.
option_2: The captain said his soldiers to follow the enemy.
option_3: The captain requested his soldiers to follow the enemy.
option_4: The captain commanded his soldiers to follow the enemy.
solution:
The correct option that expresses the given sentence in reported speech is: "The captain commanded his soldiers to follow the enemy."

This option is correct. It uses "commanded," which accurately conveys the idea of giving a strong order, and the structure "to follow" is grammatically accurate for reported speech.

In summary, the correct answer is "The captain commanded his soldiers to follow the enemy" because it uses an appropriate reporting verb and maintains the correct structure for conveying the order in reported speech.
